title: RGB-Only Gaussian Splatting SLAM for Unbounded Outdoor Scenes
author: Sicheng Yu (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Chong Cheng (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Yifan Zhou (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Xiaojun Yang (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Hao Wang (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), ...
relevance_why: The techniques developed in this paper for SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) using RGB images could inspire advancements in dynamic audio environments, particularly in spatial audio applications where scene mapping is relevant.
background: The task involves creating a mapping and localization system that only uses RGB images to effectively navigate and recreate unbounded outdoor scenes without depth information.
contribution: This paper introduces OpenGS-SLAM, a novel RGB-only SLAM framework that enhances tracking accuracy and novel view synthesis for outdoor environments, achieving significantly reduced tracking error compared to prior methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous RGB-D or Gaussian-based SLAM methods struggled with depth estimation and limited to indoor settings.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work bypasses depth requirements by utilizing a pointmap regression network for pose estimation, enabling robust tracking in complex outdoor scenarios.

key_innovation: Combines pointmap regression with 3D Gaussian Splatting to create a differentiable pipeline for simultaneous optimization of camera pose and scene representation.
real_world_impact: The proposed method is designed to improve autonomous navigation and mapping tasks in outdoor environments, making it valuable for applications such as autonomous driving and robotics.
limitations: No specific limitations are mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.3D Gaussian Splatting: **3D Gaussian Splatting** refers to a method of representing 3D scenes using Gaussian distributions to enable efficient rendering and scene representation.
new_terms.pointmap regression: **Pointmap regression** is a technique to generate consistent point mappings between image frames for improved pose estimation.
